title: “Life is short. Kiss slowly, laugh insanely, love truly and forgive quickly”

author: Immanuel Kant
title: “Rules for happiness: something to do, someone to love, something to hope for.”

author: Maurice Maeterlinck

author: Mark Gorman
title: “Leaders live by choice, not by accident.”

author: Sojourner Truth
title: “I'm not going to die, I'm going home like a shooting star.”

author: Mother Teresa
title: “I prefer you to make mistakes in kindness than work miracles in unkindness.”

author: George E. Woodberry
title: “Defeat is not the worst of failures. Not to have tried is the true failure.”

author: Joanna R. Macy
title: “If the world is to be healed through human efforts, I am convinced it will be by ordinary people, people whose love for this life is even greater than their fear.”

author: Nizar Qabbani
title: “Light is more important than the lantern,

author: Anne Frank
title: “I've learned one thing: you can only really get to know a person after a row. Only then can you judge their true character!”

author: A.A. Bell
title: “I'm not afraid of dying. I'm afraid I'll never get a chance to live!”

author: Voltaire
title: “L'homme est libre au moment qu'il veut l'être.”

author: Farid Attar
title: “The home we seek is in eternity;

author: Anthony Robbins
title: “In life, you need either inspiration or desperation.”

author: R.A. Salvatore
title: “We are all dying, every moment that passes of every day. That is the inescapable truth of this existence. It is a truth that can paralyze us with fear, or one that can energize us with impatience, with the desire to explore and experience, with the hope- nay, the iron-will!- to find a memory in every action. To be alive, under sunshine, or starlight, in weather fair or stormy. To dance with every step, be they through gardens of flowers or through deep snows.”

author: Sylvia Plath
title: “I have stitched life into me like a rare organ”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Be the kind of person who dares to face life's challenges and overcome them rather than dodging them.”

author: E.M. Forster
title: “Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.”

author: Suzy Kassem
title: “HEARTWORK

author: Lang Leav
title: “Letting him go

author: Ernest Hemingway
title: “Dying was nothing and he had no picture of it nor fear of it in his mind. But living was a field of grain blowing in the wind on the side of a hill. Living was a hawk in the sky. Living was an earthen jar of water in the dust of the threshing with the grain flailed out and the chaff blowing. Living was a horse between your legs and a carbine under one leg and a hill and a valley and a stream with trees along it and the far side of the valley and the hills beyond.”

author: Anonymous
title: “The power of God is with you at all times; through the activities of mind, senses, breathing, and emotions; and is constantly doing all the work using you as a mere instrument.”

author: Hayao Miyazaki
title: “To be born means being compelled to choose an era, a place, a life. To exist here, now, means to lost the possibility of being countless other potential selves.. Yet once being born there is no turning back. And I think that's exactly why the fantasy worlds of cartoon movies so strongly represent our hopes and yearnings. They illustrate a world of lost possibilities for us.”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “We are always falling in love or quarreling, looking for jobs or fearing to lose them, getting ill and recovering, following public affairs. If we let ourselves, we shall always be waiting for some distraction or other to end before we can really get down to our work. The only people who achieve much are those who want knowledge so badly that they seek it while the conditions are still unfavorable. Favorable conditions never come.”

author: Katie Kacvinsky
title: “Life should be a risk. It's more than a straight line that you can see clearly from one point to the other. It dips and curves and you never know what's around the bend sometimes until you get there. That scares a lot of people. But that's the beauty of it.”

author: Philip Pullman
title: “That’s the duty of the old, to be anxious on behalf of the young. And the duty of the young is to scorn the anxiety of the old.”

author: Susane Colasanti
title: “The rain fluctuates between drizzle and torrential. It messes with your mind. It makes you think things will always be like this, never getting better, always letting you down right when you though the worst was over.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Remember that things are not always as they appear to be… Curiosity creates possibilities and opportunities.”

author: Reba McEntire
title: “Living might mean taking chances, but they're worth taking. Loving might be a mistake. but its worth making”

author: Mary Daly
title: “The word ‘sin’ is derived from the Indo-European root ‘es-,’ meaning ‘to be.’ When I discovered this etymology, I intuitively understood that for a [person] trapped in patriarchy, which is the religion of the entire planet, ‘to be’ in the fullest sense is ‘to sin'.”

author: Leena Ahmad Almashat
title: “Those who don't jump will never fly.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “Temptation is the feeling we get when encountered by an opportunity to do what we innately know we shouldn't.”

author: Aaron Sorkin
title: “Toby Zeigler: There's literally no one in the world I don't hate right now.”

author: Rene Denfeld

author: Napoleon Hill
title: “Opinions are the cheapest commodities on earth. Everyone has a flock of opinions ready to be wished upon anyone who will accept them. If you are influenced by "opinions" when you reach DECISIONS, you will not succeed in any undertaking.”

author: Aaron Lauritsen
title: “There is strange comfort in knowing that no matter what happens today, the Sun will rise again tomorrow.”

author: Tonya Hurley
title: “We all like to think the world ends when we do. The truth is our acquaintances, our friends, and our loved ones all live on, and through them, so do we. It's not about what you had, but what you gave. It's not about how you looked, but how you lived. And it's not just about being remembered. It's about giving people a good reason to remember you.”

author: George Gordon Byron
title: “For truth is always strange; stranger than fiction.”

author: Ursula K. Le Guin
title: “For a word to be spoken, there must be silence. Before, and after.”

author: Brigid Lowry
title: “I'm hungry for a juicy life. I lean out my window at night and I can taste it out there, just waiting for me.”

author: Lorrie Moore
title: “They had, finally, the only thing anyone really wants in life: someone to hold your hand when you die.”

author: Amy Summers
title: “I had a dream about you last night... you were a giant slinky and I watched you fall down the stairs.”

author: Terry Pratchett
title: “It was the living who ignored the strange and wonderful, because life was too full of the boring and mundane.”

author: Ernest Becker

author: Mae West
title: “I never loved another person the way I loved myself.”

author: Bob Marley
title: “Don't forget your history nor your destiny”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Do good, live in the most positive and joyful way possible every day.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Until you change how you get things done, you'll never know what works best.”

author: Gabrielle Zevin
title: “Love stories are written in millimeters and milliseconds with a fast, dull pencil whose marks you can barely see, they are written in miles and eons with a chisel on the side of a mountiantop”

author: Margaret Mead
title: “There is no greater insight into the future than recognizing...when we save our children, we save ourselves”

author: Lady Gaga
title: “This is who the fuck I am.”

author: Abraham Lincoln
title: “If there is anything that links the human to the divine, it is the courage to stand by a principle when everybody else rejects it.”

author: John Eldredge
title: “We think you'll find that every woman in her heart of hearts longs for three things: to be romanced, to play an irreplaceable role in a great adventure, and to unveil beauty. That's what makes a woman come alive.”

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: “Accept whatever comes to you woven in the pattern of your destiny, for what could more aptly fit your needs?”

author: Wendell Berry
title: “What I stand for is what I stand on.”

author: Jim Rohn
title: “Either you run the day or the day runs you..”

author: Amy Poehler
title: “It’s never overreacting to ask for what you want and need.”

author: Benito Mussolini
title: “It is better to live one day as a lion than 100 years as a sheep.”

author: Neil Armstrong
title: “That's one small step for a man, one giant leap for mankind”

author: Jodi Picoult

author: Barbara Kingsolver
title: “Sugar, it's no parade but you'll get down the street one way or another, so you'd just as well throw your shoulders back and pick up the pace.”

author: Anne Lamott
title: “...most of the time, all you have is the moment, and the imperfect love of the people around you.”

author: Charles Dickens
title: “And a beautiful world we live in, when it is possible, and when many other such things are possible, and not only possible, but done-- done, see you!-- under that sky there, every day.”

author: W.H. Auden
title: “I am sure it is everyone’s experience, as it has been mine, that any discovery we make about ourselves or the meaning of life is never, like a scientific discovery, a coming upon something entirely new and unsuspected; it is rather, the coming to conscious recognition of something, which we really knew all the time but, because we were unwilling to formulate it correctly, we did not hitherto know we knew.”

author: Cecelia Ahern
title: “Hope like that, as I thought before, doesn’t make you a weak person. It’s hopelessness that makes you weak. Hope makes you stronger, because it brings with it a sense of reason. Not a reason for how or why they were taken from you, but a reason for you to live. Because it’s a maybe. A ‘maybe someday things won’t always be this shit.’ And that ‘maybe’ immediately makes the shittiness better.”

author: Philip Pullman
title: “because he's Will”

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
title: “Arrogance on the part of the meritorious is even more offensive to us than the arrogance of those without merit: for merit itself is offensive.”

author: Hazrat Ali Ibn Abu-Talib A.S
title: “The nourishment of body is food, while the nourishment of the soul is feeding others.”

author: Jonathan Safran Foer
title: “If we were to one day encounter a form of life more powerful and intelligent than our own, and it regarded us as we regard fish, what would be our argument against being eaten?”

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
title: “The house, the stars, the desert -- what gives them their beauty is something that is invisible!”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “The difference between me and other people is that they all walk around with onion skins wrapped around them. Pre-meditations, pretentions, the faces that they present to the world, the faces that they present to themselves.. onion skins that come in layer after layer. They're on the inside of all that. And I... I am the inside of the onion skin walking around. I am only me.”

author: Ursula K. Le Guin
title: “It's a rare gift, to know where you need to be, before you've been to all the places you don't need to be.”

author: Demi Lovato

author: Jerome K. Jerome
title: “I don't know why it should be, I am sure; but the sight of another man asleep in bed when I am up, maddens me.”

author: Ally Carter
title: “If you ever put a student at this school in danger again-'

title: “Let a smile be your umbrella, and you'll end up with a face full of rain. ”

author: Jay Kristoff

title: “You could shove it up your ass and pretend you're a corn dog.

author: Hunter S. Thompson
title: “This is the fast lane, folks...and some of us like it here.”

author: Morrissey
title: “I was happy in the haze of a drunken hour, but heaven knows I'm miserable now.”

author: Douglas Adams
title: “The Hitch Hiker's Guide to the Galaxy offers this definition of

author: Victoria Schwab
title: “What are you?" she asked. "A monster," said Kell hoarsely. "You'd better let me go." The girl gave a small, mocking laugh. "Monsters don't faint in the presence of ladies." "Ladies don't dress like men and pick pockets," retorted Kell. Her smile only sharpened. "What are you really?" "Tied to your bed," said Kell matter-of-factly. "And?" His brow furrowed. "And in trouble.”

author: Ilona Andrews
title: “Because he has the best equipment in the City and he knows how to use it!”

author: Taylor Swift
title: “Now stand in the corner, and think about what you've done!”

author: Alexandre Dumas
title: “How is it that little children are so intelligent and men so stupid? It must be education that does it”

author: Dave Barry
title: “Camping is nature's way of promoting the motel business. ”

title: “Nobody will ever win the battle of the sexes. There is too much fraternizing with the enemy.”

author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips
title: “You couldn't be satisfied with being an amateur asshole, could you, Jimbo! You had to go and turn pro on me!”

author: Claudia Gray
title: “ Huging my pillow to my chest, I told myself, At least soon you won't have so much time to miss him. Soon school will start again, and then you'll be busier.

title: “Professors of literature collect books the way a ship collects barnacles, without seeming effort.”

author: Oscar Wilde

author: P.G. Wodehouse
title: “She fitted into my biggest arm-chair as if it had been built round her by someone who knew they were wearing arm-chairs tight about the hips that season”

author: Erma Bombeck
title: “Humor is a spontaneous, wonderful bit of an outburst that just comes. It's unbridled, its unplanned, it's full of suprises.”

author: Jim Butcher
title: “Sometimes the most remarkable things seem commonplace. I mean when you think about it jet travel is pretty freaking remarkable. You get in a plane it defies the gravity of a entire planet by exploiting a loophole with air pressure and it flies across distances that would take months or years to cross by any means of travel that has been significant for more than a century or three. You hurtle above the earth at enough speed to kill you instantly should you bump into something and you can only breathe because someone built you a really good tin can that seems tight enough to hold in a decent amount of air. Hundreds of millions of man-hours of work and struggle and research blood sweat tears and lives have gone into the history of air travel and it has totally revolutionized the face of our planet and societies.

author: Cassandra Clare
title: “She had never imagined she had the power to make someone else so happy. And not a magical power, either--a purely human one.”

author: Thomas Mann
title: “It is love, not reason, that is stronger than death.”

author: Richelle Mead
title: “I’m not a warrior or a goddess,” I said at last.

author: Colleen Hoover
title: “The only difference between falling in love and being in love is that your heart already knows how you feel, but your mind is too stubborn to admit it.”

author: Diana Wynne Jones
title: “To love someone enough to let them go, you had to let them go forever or you did not love them that much.”

author: Shannon Alder
title: “If he can't handle you at your worst then he does not deserve you at your best. Real love means seeing beyond the words spoken out of pain, and instead seeing a person's soul.”

author: Gillian Flynn
title: “...and you drink a little too much and try a little too hard. And you go home to a cold bed and think, 'That was fine'. And your life is a long line of fine.”

author: Khalil Gibran
title: “And think not you can direct the course of love, for love, if it finds you worthy, directs your course.”

author: Lucy Maud Montgomery
title: “A broken heart in real life isn't half as dreadful as it is in books. It's a good deal like a bad tooth, though you won't think THAT a very romantic simile. It takes spells of aching and gives you a sleepless night now and then, but between times it lets you enjoy life and dreams and echoes and peanut candy as if there were nothing the matter with it.”

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: “You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving.”

author: Kristin Hannah
title: “Love. It was the beginning and end of everything, the foundation and the ceiling and the air in between.”

author: Sergei Lukyanenko
title: “Love is happiness, but only when you believe it will last forever. Even though every time it turns out to be a lie, it’s only faith that gives love its strength and its joy.”

author: Deb Caletti
title: “When what you want is a relationship, and not a person, get a dog.”

author: Atticus Poetry
title: “I think it’s beautiful

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “When we first met, I didn't want to get involved with anyone. I didn't have the time or energy, and I wasn't sure that I was ready for it. But you were so good to me, and I got swept up in that. And little by little, I found myself falling in love with you.”

author: Haruki Murakami
title: “Love can rebuild the world, they say, so everything's possible when it comes to love.”

author: Brenna Yovanoff
title: “I wanted to tell her that I loved her, and not in the complicated way I loved our parents, but in a simple way I never had to think about. I loved her like breathing.”

author: Franz Kafka
title: “You are at once both the quiet and the confusion of my heart; imagine my heartbeat when you are in this state.”

author: Christina Rossetti
title: “Ah me, but where are now the songs I sang

author: Atticus Poetry
title: “Watch carefully

author: Priya Ardis
title: “Do you think we can be friends?” I asked.

author: Laini Taylor
title: “There was a man who loved the moon, but whenever he tried to embrace her, she broke into a thousand pieces and left him drenched, with empty arms.”

author: Sri Sri Ravi Shankar
title: “Love is not an emotion. It is your very existence.”

author: Anais Nin
title: “And sometimes I believe your relentless analysis of June leaves something out, which is your feeling for her beyond knowledge, or in spite of knowledge. I often see how you sob over what you destroy, how you want to stop and just worship; and you do stop, and then a moment later you are at it again with a knife, like a surgeon.

author: Simone Elkeles
title: “I give her the only honest and true answer I have.

author: Cassandra Clare
title: “The cord pulled taut and she rebounded, flying back up before falling again. As her velocity slowed, she opened her eyes and found herself dangling at the end of the cord, about five feet above Jace. He was grinning.

author: Carrie Ryan
title: “I don't understand how I can know so little about love and how it works. How I can be so bad at it when it's all I've ever wanted.

author: Thomas Hardy
title: “Sometimes I shrink from your knowing what I have felt for you, and sometimes I am distressed that all of it you will never know.”

author: Jennifer Elisabeth
title: “I met a boy whose eyes showed me that the past, present and future were all the same thing.”

author: Cinda Williams Chima
title: “Falling in love was like falling off a cliff. It felt pretty much like flying until you hit the ground.”

author: Frederick Buechner
title: “Listen to your life. See it for the fathomless mystery it is. In the boredom and pain of it, no less than in the excitement and gladness: touch, taste, smell your way to the holy and hidden heart of it, because in the last analysis all moments are key moments, and life itself is grace.”

author: Dorothy Day
title: “The greatest challenge of the day is: how to bring about a revolution of the heart, a revolution which has to start with each one of us?”

author: Evanescence
title: “Don't try to fix me, I'm not broken...”

author: Ted Dekker
title: “Dive deep. Drown willingly”

author: Friedrich von Schiller
title: “To save all we must risk all.”

author: Chris Heimerdinger
title: “There are only two forces at work in this world- black and white. Only people are grey.”

author: Oliver Sacks
title: “I cannot pretend I am without fear. But my predominant feeling is one of gratitude. I have loved and been loved; I have been given much and I have given something in return; I have read and traveled and thought and written. I have had an intercourse with the world, the special intercourse of writers and readers.

author: L.M. Montgomery
title: “I've done my best, and I begin to understand what is meant by 'the joy of strife'. Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.”

author: Stormie Omartian
title: “It's not about finding ways to avoid God's judgment and feeling like a failure if you don't do everything perfectly. It's about fully experiencing God's love and letting it perfect you. It's not about being somebody you are not. It's about becoming who you really are.”

author: Fred Rogers
title: “It's a beautiful day in this neighborhood,

author: Lillian Hellman
title: “It's a sad day when you find out that it's not accident or time or fortune, but just yourself that kept things from you.”

author: Nelson Mandela
title: “Sometimes it falls upon a generation to be great, you can be that generation”

author: Neil Gaiman
title: “So that's my wish for you, and all of us, and my wish for myself. Make New Mistakes. Make glorious, amazing mistakes. Make mistakes nobody's ever made before. Don't freeze, don't stop, don't worry that it isn't good enough, or it isn't perfect, whatever it is: art, or love, or work or family or life.”

author: Victor Hugo
title: “This first glance of a soul which does not yet know itself is like dawn in the heavens; it is the awakening of something radiant and unknown.”

author: Margaret Peterson Haddix
title: “I want to Live! Not Die, Not Hide, LIVE!”

author: Lynn Austin
title: “Faith don't come in a bushel basket, Missy. It come one step at a time. Decide to trust Him for one little thing today, and before you know it, you find out He's so trustworthy you be putting your whole life in His hands.”

author: Michelle Paver
title: “Evil exists in us all, Torak. Some fight it. Some feed it. That's how it's always been.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “Like a missing tooth, sometimes an absence is more noticeable than a presence.”

author: Mahatma Gandhi
title: “True beauty lies in purity of the heart.”

author: Shiv Khera
title: “Under Adverse conditions - some people break down,some break records”

author: Jacqueline Winspear
title: “Grace isn't a little prayer you chant before receiving a meal. It's a way to live.”

author: Leigh Bardugo
title: “What is she to you anyway?

author: Giacomo Casanova
title: “If you have not done things worthy of being written about, at least write things worthy of being read.”

author: Pittacus Lore
title: “You kick ass Sam. And don't forget it”

author: Ayn Rand
title: “She smiled. She knew she was dying. But it did not matter any longer. She had known something which no human words could ever tell and she knew it now. She had been awaiting it and she felt it, as if it had been, as if she had lived it. Life had been, if only because she had known it could be, and she felt it now as a hymn without sound, deep under the little whole that dripped red drops into the snow, deeper than that from which the red drops came. A moment or an eternity- did it matter? Life, undefeated, existed and could exist. She smiled, her last smile, to so much that had been possible.”

author: Terry Pratchett
title: “It was the living who ignored the strange and wonderful, because life was too full of the boring and mundane.”

author: Gloria Steinem
title: “Rich People plan for three generations

author: Anna Freud
title: “I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence, but it comes from within. It is there all the time.”

author: Amit Ray
title: “Enjoy the limitless bliss consciousness here and now. The reality of you lies much beyond your sensory perceptions and boundaries.”

author: Jim Butcher
title: “There are things you can't walk away from. Not if you want to live with yourself afterward.”

author: Ernesto "Che" Guevara
title: “Silence is argument carried out by other means.”

author: Shaun David Hutchinson
title: “We remember the past, live in the present, and write the future.”

author: Susan Elizabeth Phillips
title: “I finally figured out that not every crisis can be managed. As much as we want to keep ourselves safe, we can't protect ourselves from everything. If we want to embrace life, we also have to embrace chaos.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “Sometimes it's the same moments that take your breath away that breathe purpose and love back into your life.”

author: Marcel Duchamp
title: “All this twaddle, the existence of God, atheism, determinism, liberation, societies, death, etc., are pieces of a chess game called language, and they are amusing only if one does not preoccupy oneself with 'winning or losing this game of chess.”

author: Nick Hornby
title: “There had been times when he knew, somewhere in him, that he would get used to it, whatever it was, because he had learnt that some hard things became softer after a very little while.”

author: Dylan Moran
title: “People will kill you. Over time. They will shave out every last morsel of fun in you with little, harmless sounding phrases that people uses every day, like: 'Be realistic!'

author: Natalie Babbitt
title: “dont be afraid of death, be afraid of the unlived life.”

author: Sylvia Plath
title: “I saw the years of my life spaced along a road in the form of telephone poles threaded together by wires. I counted one, two, three... nineteen telephone poles, and then the wires dangled into space, and try as I would, I couldn't see a single pole beyond the nineteenth.”

author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky
title: “But I always liked side-paths, little dark back-alleys behind the main road- there one finds adventures and surprises, and precious metal in the dirt.”

author: Hayley Williams
title: “Now I've gone for too long

author: David Bowie
title: “Tomorrow belongs to those who can hear it coming”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Finding the lesson behind every adversity will be the one important thing that helps get you through it.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “This is love, I think. A place where people who have been alone may lock together like hawks and spin in the air, dizzy with surprise at the connection. A place you go willingly, and with wonder”

author: Karen Thompson Walker
title: “The only thing you have to do in this life is die," said Mrs. Pinsky..."everything else is a choice.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: “Skinny guys fight till they're burger.”

author: Windhy Puspitadewi
title: “Kalau ada kupu-kupu yang terperangkap di sarang laba-laba, orang cenderung akan menolong kupu-kupu itu walaupun mungkin si laba-laba belum makan selama berhari-hari..Tapi gimana kalau yang terperangkap adalah ulat yang belum jadi kupu-kupu? Orang tetap nolong nggak? Padahal, keduanya sama. Di dunia ini, memang harus cantik supaya ditolong.”

author: Suzanne Collins
title: “Because, sometimes, things happen to people and they're not equipped to deal with them.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “What looks like garbage from one angle might be art from another. Maybe it

author: Emily Giffin
title: “His words are like the sound of a needle dragging across a record. A sinking, sickening feeling washes over me. This is why you should never, ever get your hopes up. This is why you should see the glass as half empty. So, when the whole things spills, you aren't as devastated.”

author: Charles M. Schulz
title: “Sometimes I feel that life has passed me by... Do you ever feel that way, Charlie Brown?

author: Quentin Tarantino
title: “If my answers frighten you then you should cease asking scary questions.”

author: Hank Moody
title: “You know why love stories have happy endings?” I shake my head.

author: Wallace Stegner
title: “It is the beginning of wisdom when you recognize that the best you can do is choose

author: Mary Hoffman

author: Wally Lamb
title: “The seeker embarks on a journey to find what he wants and discovers, along the way, what he needs.”

author: Khaled Hosseini
title: “I have a theory about marriage, Monsieur Boustouler. And it's that nearly always you will know within two weeks if it's going to work. It's astonishing how many people remain shackled for years, decades even, in a protracted and mutual state of self-delusion and false hope when in fact they had their answer in those first two weeks.”

author: Jim Morrison
title: “Cancel my subscription to the resurrection.”

author: Christopher Hitchens
title: “The clear awareness of having been born into a losing struggle need not lead one into despair. I do not especially

author: Renee Ahdieh
title: “You have a beautiful laugh. Like the promise of tomorrow.”

author: Stephenie Meyer
title: “Sometimes you have to learn to love what's good for you.”

author: Charles H. Spurgeon
title: “Faith goes up the stairs that love has built and looks out the windows which hope has opened.”

author: Alessandra Torre
title: “A gentleman holds my hand.

author: أحمد خيري العمري
title: “من قال لك أن درب الجنة معبد بالورود؟”

author: Jamie Weise
title: “I remember when your name was just another name that rolled without thought off my tongue.

author: Shannon Alder
title: “When someone you love says goodbye you can stare long and hard at the door they closed and forget to see all the doors God has open in front of you.”

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
title: “Love all God’s creation, both the whole and every grain of sand. Love every leaf, every ray of light. Love the animals, love the plants, love each separate thing. If thou love each thing thou wilt perceive the mystery of God in all; and when once thou perceive this, thou wilt thenceforward grow every day to a fuller understanding of it: until thou come at last to love the whole world with a love that will then be all-embracing and universal.”

author: Becca Fitzpatrick
title: “It isn't about love," Vee said. "It's about fun.”

author: Don Miguel Ruiz
title: “Prayer for Love

author: Steve Harvey
title: “Don't be afraid to lose him, because if a man truly loves you, he's not going anywhere”

author: Audrey Niffenegger (The Time Traveler's Wife)
title: “Clare, I want to tell you, again, I love you. Our love has been the thread through the labyrinth, the net under the high-wire walker, the only real thing in this strange life of mine that I could ever trust. Tonight I feel that my love for you has more density in this world than I do, myself: as though it could linger on after me and surround you, keep you, hold you.”

author: Rosamund Lupton
title: “When I talk about unrequited love, most of you probably think about romantic love, but there are many other kinds of love that are not adequately returned, if they are returned at all. An angry adolescent may not love her mother back as her mother loves her; an abusive father doesn't return the innocent open love of his young child. But grief is the ultimate unrequieted love. However hard and however long we love someone who has died, they can never love us back. At least that is how it feels...”

author: Jane Austen
title: “Dare not say that man forgets sooner than woman, that his love has an earlier death.”

author: Cassandra Clare
title: “Simon: So were you following me? Or is it just an amazing coincidence that you happened to be on the roof of a building I was walking by when I got attacked?

author: Rainbow Rowell
title: “I’m sort of… coming off a bad relationship”

author: Mary Ann Shaffer
title: “Think of it! We could have gone on longing for one another and pretending not to notice forever. This obsession with dignity can ruin your life if you let it.”

author: Hilary Duff
title: “Soulmate" is an overused term, but a true soul connection is very rare, and very real.”

author: Plato
title: “Love is born into every human being; it calls back the halves of our original nature together; it tries to make one out of two and heal the wound of human nature.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater
title: “He'd only been gone two seconds, but the room got brighter when they were together, as if they were two elements that became brilliant in proximity. At Sam's clumsy efforts to carry the vacuum, Grace smiled a new smile that I thought only he ever got, and he shot her a withering look full of the sort of subtext you could only get from a lot of conversations whispered after dark.

author: Walt Disney
title: “If you don't like Cinderella because she seems so "naive" and "weak," listen to this quote from the Walt himself: "She believed in dreams, all right, but she also believed in doing something about them. When Prince Charming didn't come along, she went over to the palace and got him.”

author: Boris Pasternak
title: “They loved each other, not driven by necessity, by the "blaze of passion" often falsely ascribed to love. They loved each other because everything around them willed it, the trees and the clouds and the sky over their heads and the earth under their feet.”

author: Suzanne Young
title: “...some things are better left in the past. And true things are destined to repeat themselves.”

author: Rachel Vincent
title: “I want you. I want you so badly I can’t stand it. When you left, it felt like the world got darker. Like I couldn’t truly see anything. Couldn’t feel anything.”

author: Uncle Kracker
title: “You make me smile like the sun, fall out bed, sing like a bird, dizzy in my head. Spin like a record crazy on a sunday night. You make me dance like a fool, forget how to breath, shine like the sun buzz like a bee, just the thought of you can drive me wild. Oh you make me smile. -Uncle Kracker-”

author: Taylor Mali
title: “Falling In Love Is Like Owning A Dog.

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “They wouldn't understand, and I don't feel the need to explain, simply because I know in my heart how real it was. When I think of you, I can't help smiling, knowing that you've completed me somehow. I love you, not just for now, but for always, and I dream of the day that you'll take me in your arms again”

author: Lang Leav
title: “Like time suspended,

author: Osho
title: “I love, because my love is not dependent on the object of love. My love is dependent on my state of being. So whether the other person changes, becomes different, friend turns into a foe, does not matter, because my love was never dependent on the other person. My love is my state of being. I simply love.”

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
title: “Our sweetest songs are those of saddest thought.”

author: Shannon L. Alder
title: “The true definition of mental illness is when the majority of your time is spent in the past or future, but rarely living in the realism of NOW.”

author: Natalie Babbitt
title: “You can't have living without dying. So you can't call it living, what we got. We just are, we just be, like rocks beside the road.”

author: Jonathan Harnisch
title: “Sadly enough, the most painful goodbyes are the ones that are left unsaid and never explained.”

author: Bill Hicks
title: “Oh sorry, I was taking life seriously.”

author: Lady Gaga
title: “It doesn't matter who you are, or where you come from, or how much money you've got in your pocket. You have your own destiny and your own life ahead of you.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “Don't give up! It's not over. The universe is balanced. Every set-back bears with it the seeds of a come-back.”

author: Martin Luther King Jr.
title: “Occasionally in life there are those moments of unutterable fulfillment which cannot be completely explained by those symbols called words. Their meanings can only be articulated by the inaudible language of the heart.”

author: Amanda Hocking
title: “Being liked for the way you looked is worse than not being liked at all.”

author: David Levithan
title: “But I think we both knew, even then, that what we had was something even more rare, and even more meaningful. I was going to be his friend, and was going to show him possibilities. And he, in turn, would become someone I could trust more than myself.”

author: Craig Silvey
title: “I don't understand a thing about this world: about people, and why they do the things they do. The more I find out, the more I uncover, the more I know, the less I understand.”

author: Hajime Isayama
title: “The world is merciless, and it's also very beautiful.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Leaders are limited by their vision rather than by their abilities.”

author: Swedish Proverb
title: “Love me when I least deserve it, because that's when I really need it.”

author: Omar Khayyám
title: “This world

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “How would your life be different if…You didn’t allow yourself to be defined by your past? Let today be the day…You stop letting your history interfere with your destiny and awaken to the opportunity to release your greatest self.”

author: Soren Kierkegaard
title: “A 'no' does not hide anything, but a 'yes' very easily becomes a deception.”

author: GaryLFrancione
title: “Ethical veganism results in a profound revolution within the individual; a complete rejection of the paradigm of oppression and violence that she has been taught from childhood to accept as the natural order. It changes her life and the lives of those with whom she shares this vision of nonviolence. Ethical veganism is anything but passive; on the contrary, it is the active refusal to cooperate with injustice”

author: Leslye Walton
title: “She laughed for her wasted, difficult life that never had to be wasted or difficult in the first place.”

author: ليلى الجهني
title: “الله عادل، لكن الحياة غير عادلة. الحياة ليست مكانًا للعدل، بل لاختبار حسّنا تجاهه”

author: Sophie Kinsella
title: “A mistake isn’t a mistake unless it can’t be put right.”

author: Elif Shafak
title: “Whatever happens in your life, no matter how troubling things might seem, do not enter the neighbourhood of despair.

author: Richelle E. Goodrich
title: “Nothing in this world compares to the comfort and security of having someone just hold your hand.”

author: Erin Morgenstern
title: “You will be fine,' the fortune teller says. 'There may be decisions to make and surprises in store. Life takes us to unexpected places sometimes. The future is never set in stone, remember that.”

author: Amit Ray
title: “Life is a dance. Mindfulness is witnessing that dance.”

author: Dan Millman
title: “The world's a puzzle; no need to make sense out of it." - Socrates”

author: Sylvia Plath
title: “Life was not to be sitting in hot amorphic leisure in my backyard idly writing or not writing, as the spirit moved me. It was, instead, running madly, in a crowded schedule, in a squirrel cage of busy people. Working, living, dancing, dreaming, talking, kissing- singing, laughing, learning.”

author: William Hazlitt
title: “Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps; for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are, and what they ought to be.”

author: Epicurus
title: “I was not, I was, I am not, I care not. (Non fui, fui, non sum, non curo)”

author: Haruki Murakami
title: “My biggest fault is that the faults I was born with grow bigger each year.”

author: Joseph Campbell
title: “Where you stumble and fall, there you will find gold.”

author: Ernesto "Che" Guevara
title: “Silence is argument carried out by other means.”

author: Tupac Shakur
title: “I believe that everything that you do bad comes back to you. So everything that I do that's bad, I'm going to suffer from it. But in my mind, I believe what I'm doing is right. So I feel like I'm going to heaven”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Be the kind of person who dares to face life's challenges and overcome them rather than dodging them.”

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: “I believe in the hands that work, in the brains that think, and in the hearts that love...I believe in sunshine, fresh air, friendship, calm sleep, beautiful thoughts.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “Sometimes it's the same moments that take your breath away that breathe purpose and love back into your life.”

author: Mitch Albom
title: “You can feel the whole world and still feel lost in it. So many people are in pain-- no matter how smart or accomplished--they cry, they yearn, they hurt. But instead of looking down on things, they look up, which is where I should have been looking, too. Because when the world quiets to the sound of your own breathing, we all want the same things: comfort, love and a peaceful heart.”

author: Rene Daumal
title: “You cannot stay on the summit forever; you have to come down again. So why bother in the first place? Just this: What is above knows what is below, but what is below does not know what is above. One climbs, one sees. One descends, one sees no longer, but one has seen. There is an art of conducting oneself in the lower regions by the memory of what one saw higher up. When one can no longer see, one can at least still know.”

author: Robert A. Heinlein
title: “Be wary of strong drink, it can make you shoot at the tax collector...and miss.”

author: Kurt Vonnegut
title: “He was talking about the sign that said 'THE COMPLICATED FUTILITY OF IGNORANCE.'

author: Robert Greene
title: “For the future, the motto is, "No days unalert.”

author: Rick Riordan
title: “Leo: I'm almost out of gas! Woah, that came out wrong. I meant the burning kind!”

author: Glen Cook
title: “Every ounce of my cynicism is supported by historical precedent.”

author: George Carlin
title: “Electricity is really just organized lightning”

author: Ilona Andrews
title: “Georgie, stop trying to resurrect the shoes. They were never alive in the first place.”

author: Jasper Fforde
title: “Her majesty is one verb short of a sentence.”

author: Ann Coulter
title: “Guns are our friends because in a country without guns, I'm what's known as "prey." All females are.”

author: Benjamin Franklin
title: “If you would not be forgotten, as soon as you are dead and rotten, either write things worth reading, or do things worth writing.”

author: Oscar Wilde
title: “What fire does not destroy, it hardens”

author: Robert Louis Stevenson
title: “There are two things that men should never weary of, goodness and humility; we get none too much of them in this rough world among cold, proud people.”

author: R.J. Anderson
title: “I realized then that even though I was a tiny speck in an infinite cosmos, a blip on the timeline of eternity, I was not without purpose.”

author: David Bowie
title: “Tomorrow belongs to those who can hear it coming”

author: Coco Chanel
title: “There are people who have money and people who are rich.”

author: Tere Liye
title: “Delisa cinta ummi karena Allah.”

author: Susan Cain
title: “Don't think of introversion as something that needs to be cured...Spend your free the way you like, not the way you think you're supposed to.”

author: J.K. Rowling
title: “That's chess!" snapped Ron. "You've got to make some sacrifices!”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Remember that things are not always as they appear to be… Curiosity creates possibilities and opportunities.”

author: Daniel Goleman
title: “In a very real sense we have two minds, one that thinks and one that feels”

author: Rohinton Mistry
title: “Distance was a dangerous thing, she knew. Distance changed people.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: “Me with nothing left to lose, plotting my big revenge in the spotlight. Give me violent revenge fantasies as a coping mechanism.”

author: Vincent Van Gogh
title: “One must work and dare if one really wants to live.”

author: robert m drake
title: “It was never about the world being too big, it was more like she was too much for the world to handle.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “Temptation is the feeling we get when encountered by an opportunity to do what we innately know we shouldn't.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “The boy and his heart had become friends, and neither was capable now of betraying the other.”

author: L.J. Smith
title: “There is nothing frightening in the dark if you just face it.”

author: A.G. Howard
title: “Sometimes a flame must level a forest to ash before new growth can begin.”

author: Alexandra Bracken
title: “I don’t care,” I said, leaning my head back against the seat. “Can we just get lost and see where that lands us?”

author: Erma Bombeck
title: “Sometimes I can't figure designers out. It's as if they flunked human anatomy.”

author: Elizabeth Zimmerman
title: “Properly practiced, knitting soothes the troubled spirit, and it doesn't hurt the untroubled spirit either.”

author: Richelle Mead
title: “When we were almost to the other campus, I felt the weird nausea hit me. I called a warning to Christian, just as a Strigoi grabbed him. But Christian was fast. Flames wreathed the Strigoi's head. He screamed and released Christian, trying frantically to put the flames out. The Strigoi never saw me coming with the stake. The whole thing took under a minute. Christian and I exchanged looks.

author: George Carlin
title: “I bet you anything that 10 times out of 10, Nicky, Vinny and Tony will beat the shit out of Todd, Kyle and Tucker.”

author: Anthony de Mello
title: “The philosopher

author: Jim Butcher
title: “If I was on the road to Hell, at least I was going in style.”

author: Jerry Seinfeld
title: “The Swiss have an interesting army. Five hundred years without a war. Pretty impressive. Also pretty lucky for them. Ever seen that little Swiss Army knife they have to fight with? Not much of a weapon there. Corkscrews. Bottle openers. ‘Come on, buddy, let’s go. You get past me, the guy in the back of me, he’s got a spoon. Back off, I’ve got the toe clippers right here.”

author: T.S. Eliot
title: “Humor is also a way of saying something serious.”

author: Brandon Mull
title: “A crossbow?” Pigeon asked.

author: Bill Watterson
title: “I'm a 21st-century kid trapped in a 19th-century family.”

author: Neil Gaiman
title: “What a refreshing mind you have, young man. There really is nothing quite like total ignorance, is there?”

author: The Kinks
title: “Give the People what they want - and they'll get what they deserve.”

author: Shelly Laurenston
title: “Dear God in heaven.”

author: Jeaniene Frost
title: “She seemed to be a nice person, too, instead of a homicidal bitch like his former wife. Otherwise, the world should fear. When Mencheres fell for a woman, he fell hard. If Kira asked for her own continent as a birthday present, Mencheres would probably have one conquered for her before she blew out her candles.”

author: Anthony Horowitz
title: “I am perfectly qualified to give you an injection. You're not going to tell me you're afraid of a little prick?

author: Bauvard
title: “The idealist hopes. The romantic sees doom. The postmodernist sees doom and hopes.”

author: Jim Butcher
title: “All of those faeries and duels and mad queens and so on, and no one quoted old Billy Shakespeare. Not even once.”

author: C.B. Cook
title: “I'm your friend, and friends don't let friends die.”

author: Laurell K. Hamilton
title: “I hate women who complain about being fat when they're like a size 5. Anything under size 5 isn't a woman. It's a boy with breasts.”

author: Cora Carmack
title: “Garrick was panting when he replied, “You’re not forcing me to do anything. I just want you to be sure. You can say stop at anytime.” His lips pulled wide. “You don’t need to make up a new pet.”

author: Darren Shan
title: “You thought I was a werewolf?" Dervish asks.

author: Matthew McConaughey
title: “It'd Be a Lot Cooler If You Did.”

author: Gerard Way
title: “Those guys who want to have the Mohawk...which, to me, is the new business casual.”

author: Susan Gordon Lydon
title: “Letting go is the lesson. Letting go is always the lesson. Have you ever noticed how much of our agony is all tied up with craving and loss?”

author: Veronica Roth
title: “I pull my foot back again, but Four's hands clamp around my arms, and he pulls me away from her with irresistible force. I breathe through gritted teeth, staring at Molly's blood-covered face, the color deep and rich and beautiful, in a way. She groans, and I hear a gurgling in her throat, watch blood trickle from her lips. "You won," Four mutters. "Stop." I wipe the sweat from my forehead. He stares at me. His eyes too wide; they look alarmed. "I think you should leave," he says. "Take a walk." I'm fine," I say. "I'm fine now," I say again, this time for myself.

author: Banana Yoshimoto
title: “But I have my life, I’m living it. It’s twisted, exhausting, uncertain, and full of guilt, but nonetheless, there’s something there.”

author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: “You had to risk your life to get love. You had to get right to the edge of death to ever be saved.”

author: Tom Bodett
title: “The difference between school and life? In school, you're taught a lesson and then given a test. In life, you're given a test that teaches you a lesson.”

author: J.M. Barrie
title: “The life of every man is a diary in which he means to write one story, and writes another; and his humblest hour is when he compares the volume as it is with what he vowed to make it.”

author: John Green
title: “I liked being a person. I wanted to keep at it.”

author: Charlotte Eriksson
title: “I thought that if I owned nothing, had nothing, was nothing, I would have nothing left to lose, and I wouldn't be scared anymore. Because my whole life I’ve been so damn scared. Scared to live because I was scared to die. But at the same I was so scared of living, so I wanted to die. Or maybe so scared of dying that I refused to live. You don't have to be afraid to fall, when you're already on the ground. You don't have to be scared to lose someone, when there's no one around to lose.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “People will always have opinions about your decision because they're not courageous enough to take action on their opinion.”

author: Harold Kushner
title: “I think of life as a good book. The further you get into it, the more it begins to make sense.”

author: Quentin Crisp
title: “The young always have the same problem - how to rebel and conform at the same time. They have now solved this by defying their parents and copying one another.”

author: Marcus Aurelius
title: “Your days are numbered. Use them to throw open the windows of your soul to the sun. If you do not, the sun will soon set, and you with it.”

author: Charles deLint
title: “There are no happy endings... There are no endings, happy or otherwise. We all have our own stories which are just part of the one Story that binds both this world and Faerie. Sometimes we step into each others stories - perhaps just for a few minutes, perhaps for years - and then we step out of them again. But all the while, the Story just goes on.”

author: C. JoyBell C.
title: “It is when we think we can act like God, that all respect is lost, and I think this is the downfall of peace. We lie if we say we do not see color and culture and difference. We fool ourselves and cheat ourselves when we say that all of us are the same. We should not want to be the same as others and we should not want others to be the same as us. Rather, we ought to glory and shine in all of our differences, flaunting them fabulously for all to see! It is never a conformity that we need! We need not to conform! What we need is to burst out into all these beautiful colors!”

author: Isaac Bashevis Singer
title: “Kindness, I’ve discovered, is everything in life.”

author: Elizabeth Scott
title: “There are a million rules for being a girl. There are a million things you have to do to get through each day. High school has things that can trip you up, ruin you, people say one thing and mean another, and you have to know all the rules, you have to know what you can and can't do.”

author: Bill Watterson
title: “HOBBES:

author: Lisa Kleypas
title: “The span of three or four minutes is pretty insignificant in the scheme of things. People lose hundreds of minutes everyday, squandering them on trivial things. But sometimes in those fragments of time, something can happen you'll remember the rest of your life.”

author: Beverly Donofrio
title: “One day can change your life. One day can ruin your life. All life is is three or four big days that change everything.”

author: Shaun David Hutchinson
title: “Because you can only die once but you can suffer forever.”

author: Jeanette Winterson
title: “Everyone who tells a story tells it differently, just to remind us that everybody sees it differently. Some people say there are true things to be found, some people say all kinds of things can be proved. I don't believe them. The only thing for certain is how complicated it all is, like string full of knots. It's all there but hard to find the beginning and impossible to fathom the end. The best you can do is admire the cat's cradle, and maybe knot it up a bit more.”

author: Robyn Schneider
title: “That's all you can do in this world, no matter how strong the current beats against you, or how heavy your burden, or how tragic your love story. You keep going.”

author: Ray Bradbury
title: “That's life for you," said MacDunn. "Someone always waiting for someone who never comes home. Always someone loving some thing more than that thing loves them. And after a while you want to destroy whatever that thing is, so it can't hurt you no more.”

author: Brian Tracy
title: “Excellence/Perfection is not a destination; it is a continuous journey that never ends.”

author: Haruki Murakami
title: “It seemed to me that this world has a serious shortage of both logic and kindness.”

author: Roald Dahl
title: “I think probably kindness is my number one attribute in a human being. I'll put it before any of the things like courage or bravery or generosity or anything else.

author: Philippa Gregory
title: “I have given my word that only death will take me from you.”

author: Robertson Davies
title: “Happiness is always a by-product. It is probably a matter of temperament, and for anything I know it may be glandular. But it is not something that can be demanded from life, and if you are not happy you had better stop worrying about it and see what treasures you can pluck from your own brand of unhappiness.”

author: Jimmy Buffett
title: “One of the inescapable encumbrances of leading an interesting life is that there have to be moments when you almost lose it.”

author: Edgar Lee Masters
title: “To put meaning in one's life may end in madness,

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “Maybe we've lived a thousand lives before this one and in each of them we've found each other... I know I've spent each life before this one searching for you. Not someone like you but you, for your soul and mine must always come together.”

author: Oswald Chambers
title: “If through a broken heart God can bring His purposes to pass in the world, then thank Him for breaking your heart.”

author: Sophie Kinsella
title: “If you can't be honest with your friends and colleagues and loved ones, then what is life all about?”

author: Viktor E. Frankl
title: “What is demanded of man is not, as some existential philosophers teach, to endure the meaninglessness of life, but rather to bear his incapacity to grasp its unconditional meaningfulness in rational terms.”

author: Nick Hornby
title: “There had been times when he knew, somewhere in him, that he would get used to it, whatever it was, because he had learnt that some hard things became softer after a very little while.”

author: Paul Theroux
title: “The wish to travel seems to me characteristically human: the desire to move, to satisfy your curiosity or ease your fears, to change the circumstances of your life, to be a stranger, to make a friend, to experience an exotic landscape, to risk the unknown..”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Finding the lesson behind every adversity will be the one important thing that helps get you through it.”

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
title: “Religion can never reform mankind because religion is slavery. It is far better to be free, to leave the forts and barricades of fear, to stand erect and face the future with a smile. It is far better to give yourself sometimes to negligence, to drift with wave and tide, with the blind force of the world, to think and dream, to forget the chains and limitations of the breathing life, to forget purpose and object, to lounge in the picture gallery of the brain, to feel once more the clasps and kisses of the past, to bring life's morning back, to see again the forms and faces of the dead, to paint fair pictures for the coming years, to forget all Gods, their promises and threats, to feel within your veins life's joyous stream and hear the martial music, the rhythmic beating of your fearless heart. And then to rouse yourself to do all useful things, to reach with thought and deed the ideal in your brain, to give your fancies wing, that they, like chemist bees, may find art's nectar in the weeds of common things, to look with trained and steady eyes for facts, to find the subtle threads that join the distant with the now, to increase knowledge, to take burdens from the weak, to develop the brain, to defend the right, to make a palace for the soul. This is real religion. This is real worship”

author: Andrea Hirata
title: “Pesimistik tidak lebih daripada sikap takbur mendahului nasib.”

author: C.S. Lewis
title: “The terrible thing, the almost impossible thing, is to hand over your whole self--all your wishes and precautions--to Christ. But it is far easier than what we are all trying to do instead. For what we are trying to do is to remain what we call "ourselves," to keep personal happiness as our great aim in life, and yet at the same time be "good.”

author: Swedish Proverb
title: “Love me when I least deserve it, because that's when I really need it.”

author: Jean M. Auel
title: “You learn to write by writing, and by reading and thinking about how writers have created their characters and invented their stories. If you are not a reader, don't even think about being a writer.”

author: Steve Maraboli
title: “How would your life be different if…You didn’t allow yourself to be defined by your past? Let today be the day…You stop letting your history interfere with your destiny and awaken to the opportunity to release your greatest self.”

author: Banana Yoshimoto
title: “Again and again I will suffer; again and again I will get back on my feet. I will not be defeated. I won't let my spirit be destroyed.”

author: Richelle E. Goodrich
title: “Courage to me is doing something daring, no matter how afraid, insecure, intimidated, alone, unworthy, incapable, ridiculed or whatever other paralyzing emotion you might feel. Courage is taking action....no matter what.  So you're afraid? Be afraid.  Be scared silly to the point you're trembling and nauseous, but do it anyway!”

author: Rick Riordan
title: “You have to rise above the squabbling and chaos, and keep believing. You have to always keep your goals in mind.” -Hera, goddess of marriage ”

author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
title: “Advice is like snow; the softer it falls, the longer it dwells upon, and the deeper it sinks into the mind.”

author: Theocritus
title: “Sameron adion aso

author: Corrie Ten Boom
title: “Child, you have to learn to see things in the right proportions. Learn to see great things great and small things small.”

author: robert m drake
title: “She was broken from moment to moment, watching her world collide she felt lost inside herself. She fell apart for a passion that flamed beneath her. She waited and died a hundred times, it dripped from her pores. The moment she let go, she soared over the stillness like the star she was born to be.”

author: Ali Ibn Abi Talib A.S
title: “Take Care Of Your Tongue Like The Way You Take Care Of Gold & Silver.”

author: Tyler Knott Gregson
title: “What an utter disgrace it would be to find something truly magic and spend any time at all pretending and trying to convince yourself it is all just an unbelievably orchestrated and beautifully choreographed illusion.”

author: Gore Vidal
title: “The important thing is not the object of love, but the emotion itself.”

author: Pope Francis
title: “The media only writes about the sinners and the scandals, he said, but that's normal, because 'a tree that falls makes more noise than a forest that grows.”

author: Dwight D. Eisenhower
title: “Never let yourself be persuaded that any one Great Man, any one leader, is necessary to the salvation of America. When America consists of one leader and 158 million followers, it will no longer be America.”

author: A.A. Milne
title: “When I was One,

author: Les Brown
title: “The greatest revenge is massive success.”

author: Ayn Rand
title: “And what, incidentally, do you think integrity is? The ability not to pick a watch out of your neighbor's pocket? No, it's not as easy as that. If that were all, I'd say ninety-five percent of humanity were honest, upright men. Only, as you can see, they aren't. Integrity is the ability to stand by an idea.”

author: Billie Joe Armstrong
title: “‎The day you become old is the day you're not looking for new experiences anymore.”

author: Suzy Toronto
title: “Life is All About How you Handle Plan B

author: Chuck Palahniuk
title: “It's easy to cry when you realize that everyone you love will reject you or die.”

author: Anaïs Nin
title: “I reserve the right to love many different people at once, and to change my prince often.”

author: Suzanne Collins
title: “Not like this. He wanted it to be real.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater
title: “I could still smell her on my fur. It clung to me, a memory of another world.

author: Peter David
title: “That was when it was all made painfully clear to me. When you are a child, there is joy. There is laughter. And most of all, there is trust. Trust in your fellows. When you are an adult...then comes suspicion, hatred, and fear. If children ran the world, it would be a place of eternal bliss and cheer. Adults run the world; and there is war, and enmity, and destruction unending. Adults who take charge of things muck them up, and then produce a new generation of children and say, "The children are the hope of the future." And they are right. Children are the hope of the future. But adults are the damnation of the present, and children become adults as surely as adults become worm food.

author: Arthur Conan Doyle
title: “A man always finds it hard to realize that he may have finally lost a woman's love, however badly he may have treated her.”

author: Maggie Stiefvater
title: “Voicemail #1: “Hi, Isabel Culpeper. I am lying in my bed, looking at the ceiling. I am mostly naked. I am thinking of … your mother. Call me.”

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
title: “Love, and you shall be loved.”

author: Susan Sontag
title: “It hurts to love. It's like giving yourself to be flayed and knowing that at any moment the other person may just walk off with your skin.”

author: Tere Liye
title: “Andaikata semua kehidupan ini menyakitkan, maka di luar sana pasti masih ada sepotong bagian yang menyenangkan. Kemudian kau akan membenak pasti ada sesuatu yang jauh lebih indah dari menatap rembulan di langit. Kau tidak tahu apa itu, karna ilmumu terbatas. Kau hanya yakin , bila tidak di kehidupan ini suatu saat nanti pasti akan ada yang lebih mempesona dibanding menatap sepotong rembulan yang sedang bersinar indah.”

author: Deborah Moggach
title: “You may only call me "Mrs. Darcy"... when you are completely, and perfectly, and incandescently happy.”

author: Cassandra Clare
title: “I just don't see why the past has to matter.”

author: Dante Alighieri
title: “Love, that moves the sun and the other stars”

author: Judith McNaught
title: “Some people feel love in their hearts, Julie. Some of us feel it all way into our souls. We're the ones who can't forget.”

author: Stephanie Perkins
title: “I look at you, and I think about you, and ... I don't know. No one has ever confounded me the way you do.”

author: Emily Giffin
title: “I miss us too. I always have and I probably always will. Sometimes there are no happy endings. No matter what, I'll be losing something, someone. But maybe that's what it all comes down to. Love, not as a surge of passion, but as a choice to commit to something, someone, no matter what obstacles or temptations stand in the way. And maybe making that choice again and again, day in and day out, year after year,says more about love than never having a choice to make at all.”

author: Neil Gaiman
title: “They kissed for the first time then in the cold spring rain, though neither one of them now knew that it was raining. Tristran's heart pounded in his chest as if it was not big enough to contain all the joy that it held. He opened his eyes as he kissed the star. Her sky-blue eyes stared back into his, and in her eyes he could see no parting from her.”

author: Michelle Hodkin
title: “Two seconds later, the sound of an alarm filled my ears.

author: Joyce Carol Oates
title: “In love there are two things - bodies and words. ”

author: Beth Revis
title: “Choice or no, my heart is his.”

author: Jandy Nelson
title: “They do make love stories for girls with black hearts after all. They go like this.”

author: Candide
title: “She blushed and so did he. She greeted him in a faltering voice, and he spoke to her without knowing what he was saying.”

author: Jess Rothenberg
title: “There’s always that one guy who gets a hold on you. Not like your best friend’s brother who gets you in a headlock kind of hold. Or the little kid you’re babysitting who attaches himself to your leg kind of hold.

author: Margery Williams Bianco
title: “He didn't mind how he looked to other people, because the nursery magic had made him Real, and when you are Real shabbiness doesn't matter.”

author: David Levithan
title: “Love doesn’t have to be on Valentine’s Day. It doesn’t have to be by the time you turn eighteen or thirty-three or fifty-nine. It doesn’t have to conform to whatever is usual. It doesn’t have to be kismet at once, or rhapsody by the third day.

author: Nicholas Sparks
title: “The two of you, there's something uncanny about the way you two are with each other. I mean everything--the way you look at each other, the way she relaxes when you put your hand on her back, the way you both seem to know what the other is always thinking, it's always struck me as extraordinary. That's another reason I keep putting marriage off. I know I want something like what you two share, and I'm not sure I've found it yet. I'm not sure I ever will. And with love like that, they say anything's possible, right?”

author: Augusten Burroughs
title: “If you have one parent who loves you, even if they can't buy you clothes, they're so poor and they make all kinds of mistakes and maybe sometimes they even give you awful advice, but never for one moment do you doubt their love for you--if you have this, you have incredibly good fortune.

author: L.M. Montgomery
title: “Gilbert, I'm afraid I'm scandalously in love with you.”

author: Ann Brashares
title: “He wanted to take his love back from her so badly. The old techniques didn’t work anymore. In fact, they’d never worked. How do you stop loving someone? It was one of the world’s more brutal mysteries. The more you tried, the less it worked.”

author: Ann Brashares
title: “She knew whose love she doubted. It wasn't her parents' and it wasn't her friends: It was her own. ”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “Envy, after all, comes from wanting something that isn't yours. But grief comes from losing something you've already had.”

author: Glen Cook
title: “Every ounce of my cynicism is supported by historical precedent.”

author: Abraham Verghese
title: “You live it forward, but understand it backward.”

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
title: “Journey’s end

author: Ambrose Bierce
title: “Lottery: A tax on people who are bad at math.”

author: Jonathan Larson
title: “The heart may freeze, or it can burn. The pain will ease and I can learn. There is no future, there is no past. I live this moment as, my last.”

author: Alan Bennett
title: “We started off trying to set up a small anarchist community, but people wouldn't obey the rules.”

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: “God surely did not create us, and cause us to live, with the sole end of wishing always to die. I believe, in my heart, we were intended to prize life and enjoy it, so long as we retain it. Existence never was originally meant to be that useless, blank, pale, slow-trailing thing it often becomes to many, and is becoming to me, among the rest.”

author: Buddha
title: “May all that have life be delivered from suffering”

author: Stephen King
title: “We fool ourselves so much we could do it for a living.”

author: Paulo Coelho
title: “It is part of the human nature always to judge others very severely and,when the wind turns against us,always to find an excuse for our own misdeeds,or to blame someone else for our mistakes.”

author: Whoopi Goldberg
title: “Art and life are subjective. Not everybody's gonna dig what I dig, but I reserve the right to dig it.”

author: Michael Chabon
title: “The whole house seemed to exhale a melancholy breath of emptiness”

author: Charlotte Brontë
title: “Crying does not indicate that you are weak. Since birth, it has always been a sign that you are alive.”

author: V. Vee
title: “Inside of all of us there is the need and the desire to be heard, to have our innermost thoughts, feelings and desires expressed for others to hear, to see and to understand. We all want to matter to someone, to leave a mark. Writers just take those thoughts, feelings and desires and express them in such a way that the reader not only reads them but feels them as well.”

author: Richelle Mead
title: “But what are loyalty and caring really worth?

author: Virgil
title: “The greatest wealth is health”

author: Kelly Cutrone
title: “When you're the most happening person at the party, it's time to leave”

author: Walt Whitman
title: “WE two boys together clinging,

author: Steve Jobs
title: “Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.”

author: George R.R. Martin
title: “Men's lives have meaning, not their deaths.”

author: Kristin Cashore
title: “If her enemies were Brigan's friends and her friends were Brigan's enemies, then the two of them could walk through the world arm in arm and never be hit by arrows again.”

author: V.E. Schwab
title: “After all, if you run far enough, no one can catch you.”

author: Tom Robbins
title: “When humans were young, they were pushed around in strollers. When they were old, they were pushed around in wheelchairs. In between, they were just pushed around.”

author: Marty Rubin
title: “Morning will come, it has no choice.”

author: Elbert Hubbard
title: “Know what you want to do, hold the thought firmly, and do every day what should be done, and every sunset will see you that much nearer the goal.”

author: Shonda Rhimes
title: “They tell you: Follow your dreams. Listen to your spirit. Change the world. Make your mark. Find your inner voice and make it sing. Embrace failure. Dream. Dream and dream big. As a matter of fact, dream and don’t stop dreaming until your dream comes true.

author: Markus Zusak
title: “Why can’t the world hear? I ask myself. Within a few moments I ask it many times. Because it doesn’t care, I finally answer, and I know I’m right. It’s like I’ve been chosen. But chosen for what? I ask.”

author: Gerard Way
title: “Those guys who want to have the Mohawk...which, to me, is the new business casual.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “The most important thing is this: to be able at any moment to be free to choose a life that makes you happy.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “You know someone's right for you when the things they don't

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “All any of us wanted, really, was to know that we counted. That someone else's life would not have been as rich without us here.”

author: Nikki Giovanni
title: “the world is not a pleasant place to be without someone to hold and be held by.”

author: Elizabeth Scott
title: “The thing is, that world doesn't exist. All growing up means is that your realize no one will come along to fix things. No one will come along to save you.”

author: Jim Valvano
title: “My father gave me the greatest gift anyone could give another person, he believed in me.”

author: Emilie Autumn
title: “I cut myself because you wouldn't let me cry.

author: Al Pacino
title: “I don’t understand the hatred and fear of gays and bisexuals and lesbians…

author: irene nemirovsky
title: “Waiting is erotic”

author: Gayle Forman
title: “Love is not something you protect. It’s something you risk.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “What we all want, really, is to be loved. That craving drives our worst behavior.”

author: Ursula K. Le Guin
title: “A profound love between two people involves, after all, the power and chance of doing profound hurt.”

author: Mitch Albom
title: “Without love we all like birds with broken wings.”

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “The bottom line is that we never fall for the person we're supposed to.”

author: Mawlana Jalal-al-Din Rumi
title: “If in thirst you drink water from a cup, you see God in it. Those who are not in love with God will see only their own faces in it.”

author: Richelle Mead
title: “One of the few downsides to being awakened is that we no longer require sleep; therefore we also no longer dream. It's a shame, because if I could dream, I know I'd dream about you.I'd dream about the way you smell and how your dark hair feels like silk between my fingers. I'd dream about the smoothness of your skin and the fierceness of your lips when we kiss.

author: Rick Riordan
title: “Love was the most savage monster of all.”

author: Colleen Hoover
title: “You left with my soul in your fists and my heart in your teeth, and I don’t want either of them back.” ~Ben”

author: Nicole Kidman
title: “It's a very brave thing to fall in love. You have to be willing to trust somebody else with your whole being, and that's very difficult, really difficult and very brave.”

author: Wilhelm Stekel
title: “The opposite of love is not hate. It is indifference.”

author: Kelly Creagh
title: “You're a dream. Like everything else.”

author: Richelle Mead
title: “You know I love you, right?” The urge to kiss her goodbye was so strong that I almost broke our rules.

author: Jodi Picoult
title: “Here's a news flash for the ladies: for every one of you who thinks we all want a girl like Angelina Jolie, all skinny elbows and angles, the truth is, we'd rather curl up with someone like Charlotte - a woman who's soft when a guy wraps his arms around her; a woman who might have a smear of flour on her shirt the whole day and not notice or care, not even when she goes out to meet with the PTA; a woman who doesn't feel like an exotic vacation but is the home we can't wait to come back to.”

author: Thomas  Moore
title: “Disappointments in love, even betrayals and losses, serve the soul at the very moment they seem in life to be tragedies. The soul is partly in time and partly in eternity. We might remember the part that resides in eternity when we feel despair over the part that is in life.”

author: L.J. Smith
title: “I want him to love me as much as I love him.”

author: Julie Kagawa
title: “I think ... I should go home soon. Mom and Luke are probably going nuts. What about you?

author: Margaret Atwood
title: “What is it the I'll want from you? Not love: that would be too much to ask. Not forgiveness, which isn't yours to bestow. Only a listener, perhaps; only someone who will see me. Don't prettify me though, whatever else you do: I have no wish to be a decorated skull.

author: Aidan Chambers
title: “Love, being in love, isn’t a constant thing. It doesn’t always flow at the same strength. It’s not always like a river in flood. It’s more like the sea. It has tides, it ebbs and flows. The thing is, when love is real, whether it’s ebbing or flowing, it’s always there, it never goes away. And that’s the only proof you can have that it is real, and not just a crush or an infatuation or a passing fancy”

author: Hannah Harrington
title: “It always struck me in years after how bizarre it was, how two people could look at one another with such tenderness and complete love, and how quickly that could dissolve into nothing but bitterness.”

author: Julie Kagawa
title: “Oh, don't mind me," came an extremely sarcastic voice near the wall. “You two go ahead and make out–I'll just sit here and bleed quietly.”

author: Colleen Houck
title: “Okay, then I’ll just say I love you. There is nothing in this world more important to me than you are. I’m only content when you’re near. My whole purpose is to be what you need me to be. It’s not poetry, but it’s from my heart. Will that do?”

author: Napoleon Hill
title: “If you can't do great things, do small things in a great way.”

author: Jandy Nelson
title: “That's a misconception, Lennie. The sky is everywhere, it begins at your feet.”

author: Woodrow Wilson
title: “You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.”

author: William Blake
title: “A man can't soar too high, when he flies with his own wings.”

author: Mitch Albom
title: “If we tend to the things that are important in life, if we are right with those we love, and behave in line with our faith, our lives will not be cursed with the aching throb of unfulfilled business. Our words will always be sincere, our embraces will be tight. We will never wallow in the agony of ‘I could have, I should have’. We can sleep in a storm. And when its time, our goodbyes will be complete.”

author: Lady Gaga
title: “It doesn't matter who you are, or where you come from, or how much money you've got in your pocket. You have your own destiny and your own life ahead of you.”

author: Tyra Banks
title: “Love me or hate me I promise that it will never make or break me...<3”

author: Jane Evershed
title: “To read is to empower,

author: Oswald Chambers
title: “Faith is deliberate confidence in the character of God whose ways you may not understand at the time.”

author: Roy T. Bennett
title: “Leaders are limited by their vision rather than by their abilities.”

author: J.D. Salinger
title: “Keep me up till five because all your stars are out, and for no other reason…Oh dare to do it Buddy! Trust your heart. You’re a deserving craftsman. It would never betray you. Good night. I’m feeling very much over-excited now, and a little dramatic, but I think I’d give almost anything on earth to see you writing a something, an anything, a poem, a tree, that was really and truly after your own heart.”

author: Salim A. Fillah
title: “Di jalan cinta para pejuang, biarkan cinta berhenti di titik ketaatan.. Meloncati rasa suka dan tidak suka.. Melampaui batas cinta dan benci.. Karena hikmah sejati tak selalu terungkap di awal pagi.. Karena seringkali kebodohan merabunkan kesan sesaat.. Maka taat adalah prioritas yang kadang membuat perasaan-perasaan terkibas.. Tapi yakinlah, di jalan cinta para pejuang, Alloh lebih tahu tentang kita..”

author: Zelda Fitzgerald
title: “I don't want to live, I want to love first and live incidentally.”
